title: World Bank-IMF meetings to close some D.C. streets this week
text:
Signs for the upcoming World Bank-IMF annual meetings hang outside International Monetary Fund Headquarters in Washington on Oct. 7, 2019. (Saul Loeb/AFP)

The International Monetary Fund and World Bank fall meetings are scheduled for this week in Washington, and that means extra traffic, parking restrictions and street closings west of the White House, in the Foggy Bottom area.

Parking restrictions begin early Monday and will last all week. Parts of Pennsylvania Avenue and H Street downtown will be affected, and some portions will close to vehicular traffic starting Thursday.

Drivers should consider avoiding the area, and those who are in the area should expect delays and the possibility of protesters. D.C. police said vehicles that are parked in violation of the emergency no parking signs will be ticketed and towed.

No parking will be allowed on the following streets from 6 a.m. Monday through 5:30 p.m. Sunday:

19th Street between Pennsylvania Avenue and G Street NW

H Street between 20th Street and Pennsylvania Avenue NW

Pennsylvania Avenue between 18th and 19th streets NW (south curb lane only)

The following streets will be closed from 7 p.m. Thursday to 5:30 p.m. Sunday:
description: Parking restrictions begin early Monday and will last all week. Parts of Pennsylvania Avenue and H Street downtown will be affected, and some portions will close to vehicular traffic starting Thursday.
